Bariatric surgery is an effective form of weight loss; however, for long-term results, food quality should be prioritized, as the volumetric capacity of the stomach is reduced and requires supplementary nutritious foods. There is a natural change in the alimentary profile of the patient by reducing the intake of sweets in general, which are highly palatable and energetic, and an increase in the consumption of hyperproteic foods
